item.title: Stocks to watch, December 24: Vedanta, MMTC, TVS Motor Company, Whirlpool of India, PG Electroplast, BEL, and more - Upstox
item.description:
Stocks to watch on December 24

Date: December 24, 2023 Source: Financial News

The domestic equity market is expected to open flat on Tuesday, with investors looking toward key stock movements as several companies are in focus today due to various announcements and developments.

  • Vedanta: Trading actively as it turns ex-dividend today with a declared dividend of ‚Çπ8.50 per share.
  • MMTC: Received warning letters from NSE and BSE regarding corporate governance issues.
  • TVS Motor Company: Completed the acquisition of a 39.11% stake in DriveX Mobility.
  • Whirlpool: Signed a contract manufacturing deal with PG Electroplast for washing machines.
  • BEL: Announced new orders worth ‚Çπ973 crore, bringing total orders in 2025 to ‚Çπ9,801 crore.
  • Zaggle Prepaid Ocean Services: Raised ‚Çπ595 crore via QIP, allotting shares at a 5% discount to the floor price.
"The market remains cautious amid a holiday-curtailed week, with major U.S. indexes showing positive signs."

This week‚Äôs trading focus includes major movements in both local and global equity markets, illustrating a period of consolidation before the year-end.

item.title: Infosys' former CFO Mohandas Pai calls out ‚Äòbiggest‚Äô salary disparity in IT companies in India: Rs 3.2 la - The Times of India
item.description:
Infosys' former CFO Mohandas Pai calls out ‚Äòbiggest‚Äô salary disparity in IT companies in India: Rs 3.2 lakh in 2011 to Rs 3.75 lakh in 2024

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

Former CFO of Infosys, Mohandas Pai, has raised concerns about the significant salary disparity in the Indian IT sector, highlighting a meager increase in salaries over the past decade.

  • Salary for IT professionals reportedly rose from Rs 3.2 lakh in 2011 to Rs 3.75 lakh in 2024.
  • This increase reflects broader issues in the tech industry regarding fair compensation.
  • The discussion points to the need for addressing wage stagnation amidst rising living costs.
"The increase in salaries is not reflective of the growing demand for skilled professionals in IT."

This issue has sparked conversations about the necessity of reevaluating compensation practices in the IT sector to ensure they align with current economic realities.

item.title: Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today ‚Äî 24 December 2024 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:

Sumeet Bagadia's Recommendations

Disclaimer: The views and recommendations given in this article are those of individual analysts. These do not represent the views of Mint. We advise investors to check with certified experts before making any investment decisions.

item.title: Trade Setup for Dec 24: NIFTY50 rebounds from 200 EMA, inside candle reflects pause in momentum - Upstox
item.description:
Trade Setup for Dec 24: NIFTY50 rebounds from 200 EMA, inside candle reflects pause in momentum

Date: December 24, 2024   Source: Upstox

The NIFTY50 index began the week positively after ending a five-day losing streak, yet it displayed signs of indecision with a doji candlestick pattern. Traders should keep an eye on the levels from December 20 to determine future direction.

  • Asian markets showed minor gains in the morning.
  • U.S. indices continued to rise, particularly driven by semiconductor stocks.
  • NIFTY50 closed above 200 day EMA, but formed a doji pattern suggesting indecision.
  • Traders should watch for breaks above or below December 20‚Äôs high and low for signals.
  • FIIs sold shares worth ‚Çπ168 crore; DIIs bought shares worth ‚Çπ2,227 crore.
‚ÄúThe trend may remain range-bound unless the index breaks this range.‚Äù

This analysis highlights the indecisiveness in the market while suggesting that crucial levels from recent sessions must be monitored for decisive movements.

item.title: Mamata Machinery IPO share allotment today: Here‚Äôs how to check status online - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Mamata Machinery IPO Share Allotment Today: Check Your Status Online

Date: December 24, 2023 Source: CNBC TV18

The share allotment status for the Mamata Machinery IPO will be finalized on December 24, 2023, following an overwhelming response from investors.

  • The ‚Çπ179.39 crore IPO was oversubscribed 195 times.
  • Investors can check the allotment status via BSE, NSE, or Link Intime India.
  • The retail quota was oversubscribed 138 times, along with high demand from other categories.
  • Credit of shares is expected on December 26, with listings on NSE and BSE scheduled for December 27.

"With the stellar response to Mamata Machinery's IPO, the share allotment in the public offer is expected to be highly competitive."

The successful bidding for Mamata Machinery's IPO indicates strong market interest, setting stage for competitive share allotment and subsequent trading.

item.title: US sues Walmart, Branch Messenger for exploiting delivery drivers with $10 million junk fees: 'Companies - The Times of India
item.description:
US Sues Walmart and Branch Messenger Over $10 Million Junk Fees for Delivery Drivers

Publication Date: October 2023   Source: Times of India

The lawsuit targets Walmart and Branch Messenger for allegedly exploiting delivery drivers through excessive fees, amounting to over $10 million, that hinder their earnings.

  • This lawsuit is a response to growing concerns about delivery driver exploitation.
  • Walmart is accused of forcing drivers to pay unfair fees, dramatically affecting their income.
  • The case highlights the ongoing struggle for better working conditions in the gig economy.
‚ÄúCompanies cannot force workers to pay junk fees that deprive them of their hard-earned wages.‚Äù

This legal action sheds light on the broader issues of labor rights and fair compensation within the growing gig economy, underscoring the need for regulatory reforms.

item.title: DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment today; Steps to check status online - CNBCTV18
item.description:
DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment today; Steps to check status online

Published on: December 24, 2024, Source: CNBC TV18

The DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment is finalized today, with successful bidders receiving shares in their demat accounts and refunds for non-allottees initiated on December 26.

  • The IPO was oversubscribed 81.88 times, with bids for over 170 million shares against 2.08 million shares available.
  • Subscription details show Institutional Buyers oversubscribed by 166.33 times, while Retail Investors were oversubscribed by 26.80 times.
  • Investors can check their allotment status through BSE, NSE, or Link Intime India.
  • Share credit and refunds will occur on December 26, with a listing date set for December 27.
  • The IPO price band was set between ‚Çπ269 and ‚Çπ283 per share, raising ‚Çπ840.25 crore.
"Successful bidders will see shares credited to their accounts, while non-allottees will receive refunds on December 26."

The event marks a significant milestone for DAM Capital Advisors Ltd, enhancing its financial offerings in the IPO market.

item.title: DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment on December 24; Steps to check status online - CNBCTV18
item.description:
DAM Capital Advisors IPO Share Allotment Today - Steps to Check Status Online

First Published: Dec 24, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

The share allotment for DAM Capital Advisors Limited‚Äôs ‚Çπ840.25-crore initial public offering (IPO) is scheduled to be finalized on December 24. The IPO, which closed on December 23, was oversubscribed 81.88 times, receiving bids for 1,70,35,38,349 shares against 2,08,04,632 shares on offer.

Key Points:
  • Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs): Oversubscribed 166.33 times
  • Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs): Oversubscribed 98.47 times
  • Retail Investors: Oversubscribed 26.80 times
  • Employee Portion: Oversubscribed 40.09 times

Steps to Check IPO Allotment Status:

  1. Visit the IPO allotment page on the BSE website.
  2. Select ‚ÄòEquity‚Äô as the issue type.
  3. Choose DAM Capital Advisors Ltd from the dropdown menu.
  4. Enter your application number or PAN.
  5. Verify the CAPTCHA and click ‚ÄòSearch‚Äô to view your allotment.

Important Dates:

  • Share Credit/Refunds: December 26
  • Listing Date: December 27

About DAM Capital Advisors Ltd: DAM Capital Advisors Ltd is a rapidly growing merchant bank in India, offering services such as investment banking and institutional equities.

item.title: India to be key challenge as Honda, Nissan talk merger - The Times of India
item.description:
India to be key challenge as Honda, Nissan talk merger

Date: October 2023

Source: Automotive News

The potential merger talks between Honda and Nissan highlight the competitive landscape of the automotive industry, with particular focus on India.

  • Both companies are exploring a merger to enhance their market presence.
  • India presents a significant challenge due to its diverse market and high competition.
  • The merger could lead to increased efficiencies and product offerings.
"A merger could significantly alter the competitive dynamics in the Indian automotive market," an industry analyst stated.

The talks between Honda and Nissan underscore the shifting strategies of global automakers as they seek to adapt to emerging markets and face local competition.

item.title: New TRAI rules: Not using data? Separate recharge for calls, SMS; get validity up to 365 days - OTV News
item.description:
New TRAI rules: Separate recharge plans for calls and SMS up to 365 days

Publication Date: Monday, Source: Odishatv.in

The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has updated its tariff rules, allowing mobile service providers to offer separate plans for voice calls and SMS for customers who do not utilize data services. The validity of these special recharge coupons has been extended to a maximum of 365 days.

  • TRAI mandates at least one Special Tariff Voucher (STV) exclusively for voice calls and SMS with validity not exceeding 365 days.
  • The cap on special recharge coupon validity has been removed.
  • The decision aims to accommodate customers like senior citizens and families who may not require data services.
  • Telecom operators can now issue recharge vouchers of any value, including a minimum of Rs 10.
"The Authority is of the view that reserving of denomination of 210 and multiple thereof only for top-up voucher be done away with." - TRAI

This regulatory change is expected to benefit consumers by allowing them to pay for the services they actually use, promoting transparency and consumer choice in mobile service plans.

item.title: Switzerland-based TIL to invest Rs 20,000 crore in Vadhvan Port project - Business Standard
item.description:
Switzerland-based TIL to Invest Rs 20,000 Crore in Vadhvan Port Project

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

TIL has signed a memorandum of understanding with JNPA to invest Rs 20,000 crore in the Vadhvan Port Project, aiming to enhance port infrastructure in India.

  • Terminal Investment Ltd Sarl (TIL) to invest Rs 20,000 crore for Vadhvan Port.
  • The project is valued at Rs 76,220 crore and will be developed by JNPA and MMB.
  • The first phase of the port is expected to be completed by 2029.
  • TIL manages 70 container terminals globally, handling 65 million TEUs in 2023.
  • The project may create 1.2 million job opportunities.
‚ÄúThe MoU with TIL marks a significant step in our vision for the Vadhvan port, which is poised to redefine port infrastructure in India.‚Äù - Unmesh Sharad Wagh, JNPA Chairman

The Vadhvan port project, once completed, aims to be among the top 10 container-handling ports globally, signifying major growth in India's maritime sector.

item.title: Chile‚Äôs WOM Cleared to Exit Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Proceedings | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Chile‚Äôs WOM Cleared to Exit Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Proceedings

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Bloomberg

The Chilean telecommunications company WOM has been granted court approval to exit Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings, following a takeover and restructuring agreement with a group of creditors.

  • WOM filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy eight months ago.
  • A takeover bid from a group of bondholders valued WOM at $1.6 billion.
  • The agreement includes a $500 million investment and a net debt reduction of $650 million.
  • The decision was made by a US bankruptcy judge, rejecting a rival creditor's objection.
  • WOM has approximately 20% of the mobile market share in Chile, ranking third behind Telefonica's Movistar and Entel.
‚ÄúThe decision is a landmark in the Chapter 11 process and the efforts we have made as a team to financially restructure the company.‚Äù - Mart√≠n Vaca Narvaja, WOM‚Äôs CEO

This restructuring plan ensures the operational continuity of WOM Chile and sets the stage for its future growth.

item.title: North Korean Hackers Stole $1.3 Billion in 2024 - Watcher Guru
item.description:
North Korean Hackers Stole $1.3 Billion in Crypto in Highest Amount to Date

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Watcher.Guru

In what is a concerning development, North Korean hackers stole $1.3 billion in 2024 alone, which is more than half of the $2.2 billion stolen from cryptocurrency platforms this year. This figure marks a significant increase from 2023 and highlights ongoing challenges in cryptocurrency security.

  • Total amount stolen by North Korean hackers in 2024: $1.3 billion.
  • This amount accounts for over half of the total $2.2 billion stolen through cryptocurrency hacks this year.
  • Stolen funds have surpassed $1 billion for the fifth consecutive year.
  • The increase in hacking originated primarily from North Korean hackers posing as IT workers.
  • Private key compromises were responsible for 43.8% of these hacks.
"JUST IN: üá∞üáµ North Korean hackers stole $1,300,000,000 this year."

Overall, the rise in cryptocurrency hacking is a pressing concern for the industry, raising questions about security and regulation to protect users and platforms.

item.title: Arm, Qualcomm Shares Diverge After Lawsuit Verdict - Investor's Business Daily
item.description:
Arm, Qualcomm Shares Diverge After Lawsuit Verdict

Date: October 23, 2023 | Source: Investor's Business Daily

Arm stock fell while Qualcomm stock rose on Monday following a jury verdict favoring Qualcomm in a tech licensing dispute.

  • A jury in Delaware ruled Qualcomm had a valid license to use Arm's chip architecture.
  • The ruling allows Qualcomm to proceed with selling chips for personal computers, diversifying from smartphones.
  • Analysts view the verdict as a significant win for Qualcomm.
  • Qualcomm stock rose 2.3%, while Arm stock dropped 5.7% following the verdict.
"Overall it is hard not to view this turn of events as a clear victory for Qualcomm." - Stacy Rasgon, Bernstein analyst

In conclusion, the verdict has provided Qualcomm with leverage for future litigation, while Arm faces uncertainty regarding its licensing agreements.

item.title: Tariff impact: Reliance Jio loses 3.76 million users in October 2024 - Business Standard
item.description:
Reliance Jio Loses 3.76 Million Users in October 2024

Publication Date: October 2024 Source: Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (Trai)

In October 2024, Reliance Jio reported a loss of 3.76 million subscribers, marking the fourth consecutive month of decline. This data indicates ongoing challenges for the telecom operator amid competitive pressure and tariff hikes.

  • Jio's subscriber loss was reduced compared to previous months: 7.96 million in September and 4.01 million in August.
  • Overall, Jio has lost 16.48 million users in four months, about 3.45% of its total subscriber base.
  • Airtel added 1.92 million users in October, bouncing back after three months of decline.
  • Vodafone Idea also faced losses, shedding 1.97 million subscribers in October.
  • State-owned BSNL gained 0.51 million users in October, continuing to benefit from subscriber churn.
  • Total mobile phone connections in India decreased by 3.3 million in October.
"The tariff hikes have led to SIM consolidation and subscription cancellations, with mobile number portability requests rising slightly."

The recent user losses indicate significant shifts in the Indian telecom landscape, highlighting the impact of tariff strategies and competitive dynamics among providers.

item.title: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal and Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath invests $4 million in Aakash Chaudhry‚Äôs Sparkl - The Times of India
item.description:
Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal and Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath Invests $4 Million in Sparkl

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Sparkl, founded by Aakash Chaudhry, has secured a $4 million investment from prominent entrepreneurs Deepinder Goyal and Nithin Kamath. The investment is expected to fuel the growth of Sparkl in its quest to revolutionize the market.

  • Deepinder Goyal and Nithin Kamath make a significant investment of $4 million in Sparkl.
  • The round of funding aims to support Sparkl's development and scaling efforts.
  • Aakash Chaudhry, the founder of Sparkl, acknowledged the backing from these industry leaders.
‚ÄúThis investment marks a significant step for Sparkl as we continue to innovate and grow in the competitive market.‚Äù - Aakash Chaudhry

This investment highlights growing interest in innovative tech startups and signals confidence in Sparkl's potential to make an impact in its sector.

item.title: Oyo buys US-based G6 Hospitality from Blackstone for $525 mn, adds 1,500 hotels - Mint
item.description:
Oyo buys US-based G6 Hospitality from Blackstone for $525 mn, adds 1,500 hotels

Date: Recent publication
Source: Live Mint

Oyo has completed the acquisition of G6 Hospitality, known for its Motel 6 and Studio 6 brands, from Blackstone for $525 million. This deal is expected to significantly expand Oyo's presence in North America.

The acquisition aims to enhance Oyo's profitability, projecting an Ebitda of over ‚Çπ2,000 crore by FY26. Motel 6 is expected to contribute significantly to this goal in the upcoming financial year. Oyo will be adding about 1,500 franchised hotels across the US and Canada, with a combined booking value reaching approximately $3 billion.

  • Oyo's acquisition is worth $525 million.
  • The deal adds 1,500 hotels to Oyo's portfolio.
  • Integration of Motel 6 is expected to deliver ‚Çπ630 crore in Ebitda.
  • The acquisition aligns with Oyo‚Äôs strategy for robust growth in the US market.
  • Sonal Sinha appointed as CEO of G6 Hospitality.
‚ÄúThis acquisition represents a transformative moment for Oyo's global operations. We could see this will be a value-accretive acquisition due to their strong brand franchise in the US, potential for growth and synergies.‚Äù - Ankit Tandon, Oyo

This strategic move not only enhances Oyo's market position but also marks a significant step in its expansion plans across North America.

item.title: Galaxy phones could come with fewer preloaded Google apps - SamMobile - Samsung news
item.description:
Galaxy Phones May Have Fewer Preloaded Google Apps

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: SamMobile

Samsung may reduce the number of preloaded Google apps on its Galaxy devices if recent proposed changes by Google are implemented.

  • Samsung is known for preloading numerous apps on its devices.
  • Google faces an antitrust case that could lead to significant changes in its operation.
  • Proposals include allowing device makers to preload Google apps independently of Google Search and Chrome.
  • This could mean Samsung could choose to include specific Google apps while opting for alternatives like Microsoft OneDrive.
  • The outcome of these proposals will depend on a hearing scheduled for April 2025.
‚ÄúIf the US Department of Justice agrees to Google's proposed remedies, Samsung would be free to not ship Galaxy phones and tablets with as many Google apps as it currently does.‚Äù

In conclusion, if approved, these changes could reshape how Samsung and other manufacturers package apps on their devices, potentially enhancing user choice.

item.title: Rohan Mirchandani passed away at 42 due to heart attack. Know reasons behind cardiac arrests in winter - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohan Mirchandani passed away at 42 due to heart attack: Understanding winter cardiac arrests

Publication Date: Dec 23, 2024, Source: Hindustan Times

Rohan Mirchandani, co-founder of Epigamia, passed away due to a cardiac arrest, highlighting alarming trends of heart issues among young individuals, especially in winter.

Key Points:

  • Dr. Atul Mathur cites extreme stress and mental health issues as major causes for young heart attacks.
  • Cold weather can trigger coronary artery spasms and increase blood pressure and cholesterol levels.
  • Managing stress and adopting healthy habits are crucial for heart health in young adults.
‚ÄúChronic stress can start taking a toll on cardiovascular health early in life.‚Äù - Dr. Atul Mathur

Prevention strategies focus on managing risk factors heightened by winter conditions, emphasizing a heart-healthy lifestyle.

item.title: Mamata Machinery IPO garners whopping 194.95 times subscription on final day of share sale | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Mamata Machinery IPO Sees 194.95 Times Subscription on Final Day

Date: December 23, 2023 | Source: PTI

Mamata Machinery Ltd's IPO was oversubscribed by an impressive 194.95 times on its final day of the share sale, reflecting significant investor interest.

  • The IPO raised ‚Çπ179 crore and received bids for over 100 million shares.
  • Non-Institutional Investors subscribed 274.38 times, Qualified Institutional Buyers 235.88 times, and Retail Individual Investors 138.08 times.
  • The price range for the shares was set between ‚Çπ230 and ‚Çπ243.
  • The offering is entirely an Offer-for-Sale (OFS) of 73.82 lakh equity shares by promoters.
  • Listing aims to enhance visibility, liquidity, and establish a public market for shares.
'We anticipate that listing the equity shares will boost our visibility and brand image.'

This strong subscription indicates robust demand for Mamata Machinery‚Äôs offerings and highlights the growing investor confidence in the packaging industry.

item.title: Top 5 Fuel-Efficient Cars Of 2024 - New Swift To Citroen Basalt - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
Top 5 Fuel-Efficient Cars Of 2024 - New Swift To Citroen Basalt

Publication Date: November 2024   Source: Gaadi Waadi

In 2024, several fuel-efficient cars have made their mark in India with impressive mileage across various powertrains. Here‚Äôs a look at the top 5 most fuel-efficient cars launched this year.

  • 1. New-gen Maruti Swift: Offers a claimed fuel efficiency of 24.8 kmpl for manual and 25.75 kmpl for AMT, with CNG variants achieving 32.85 km/kg.
  • 2. New Maruti Dzire: Similar engine as the Swift, but with slightly better fuel efficiency, offering 24.79 kmpl for petrol and 33.73 km/kg for CNG.
  • 3. 2024 Kia Sonet: Achieves 22.3 kmpl with the 1.5-litre diesel and offers various petrol options with up to 19.2 kmpl.
  • 4. New Honda Amaze: Features a 1.2-litre petrol engine with a claimed efficiency of 18.65 kmpl for manual and 19.46 kmpl for CVT.
  • 5. Citroen Basalt: Provides efficiency of 18 kmpl for the naturally aspirated petrol and 19.5 kmpl for the turbocharged variant.
"When buying a new car, fuel efficiency is often a top priority after price."

This year demonstrates a continued emphasis on fuel economy across multiple car models in a competitive market.

On December 23, five initial public offerings (IPOs) closed for subscription, with significant interest from investors. The IPOs include Mamata Machinery, DAM Capital Advisors, Transrail Lighting, Sanathan Textiles, and Concord Enviro Systems.

  • The IPOs were opened for subscription on December 19.

The data indicates a strong interest and anticipation for positive gains from these offerings.

item.title: Byju‚Äôs-owned Aakash‚Äôs former CEO launches new edtech startup Sparkl - Mint
item.description:
Aakash's Former CEO Launches New Edtech Startup Sparkl

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] | Source: Mint

Aakash Chaudhry, the former CEO of Aakash Educational Services, has launched a new online learning platform named Sparkl, targeting students from grades 6 to 12.

  • The startup has received seed funding from Rainmatter, a fund led by prominent Indian entrepreneurs.
  • Sparkl focuses on providing AI-powered one-on-one tutoring for IGCSE and IB curricula.
  • Chaudhry emphasizes the need for a different economic model to make individualized education more accessible.
  • Sparkl aims at the international market, seeking to expand beyond India.
  • The model includes both online tutoring sessions and offline seminars, addressing recent shifts in edtech preferences.
‚ÄúIn an Aakash class, there is a completely heterogeneous mix of students... That's where the idea (for Sparkl) came from.‚Äù - Aakash Chaudhry

The launch comes at a critical time for the Indian edtech industry, as it navigates post-pandemic challenges and aims for recovery through innovation.
